intro: Knautia borderei, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to wildflower gardens. Knautia borderei prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in rocky or gravelly habitats.
